Content:
## News - [2025-08-22] **Bug Fix**: In Bird-Interact-Agent code, we fixed a bug that when evaluating phase-2 SQL, the stored phase-1 SQL cannot be executed successfully, leading to a lower success rate of Phase-2. This bug only affects those tasks where phase1 sql does some operations on the database, e.g. CREATE table, etc. ## üß∏ Overview BIRD-INTERACT, an interactive text-to-SQL benchmark, **re-imagines Text-to-SQL evaluation via lens of dynamic interactions**. The environment blends a hierarchical knowledge base, database documentation and a function-driven user simulator to recreate authentic enterprise environments across full **CRUD** operations. It offers two rigorous test modes: (1) passive **Conversational Interaction** and (2) active **Agentic Interaction**, spanning 600 annotated tasks including Business Intelligence (BI), CRUD operations and etc., each guarded by executable test cases. Typical evaluations trigger 1,968-5,496 interaction turns between model and user simulator, while state-of-the-art reasoning models currently solve only **‚âà24%** and **‚âà18%** of tasks, underscoring the benchmark's challenge.

### ‚úÖ Two Evaluation Modes BIRD-INTERACT supports two evaluation modes as mentioned above: - **c-Interact**: Conversational Interaction which is a passive mode and the workflow is fixed. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_conv`. - **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction which is an embodied active mode where the workflow is dynamic and led by models. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_agent`.

## ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶§‡ß∞‡¶ø - [2025-08-22] **‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶ó ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶∂‡ßã‡¶ß‡¶®**: Bird-Interact-Agent ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶°‡¶§, ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶ø ‡¶è‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶ó ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶∂‡ßã‡¶ß‡¶® ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßã‡¶Å ‡¶Ø'‡¶§ phase-2 SQL ‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡ßü‡¶®‡ß∞ ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßü‡¶§, ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡ß∞‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶∑‡¶ø‡¶§ phase-1 SQL ‡¶∏‡¶´‡¶≤‡¶≠‡¶æ‡ß±‡ßá ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶® ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶¨ ‡¶™‡ß∞‡¶æ ‡¶®‡¶æ‡¶õ‡¶ø‡¶≤, ‡¶´‡¶≤‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶¨‡ß∞‡ßÇ‡¶™ Phase-2 ‡ß∞ ‡¶∏‡¶´‡¶≤‡¶§‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶π‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶ï‡¶Æ‡¶ø ‡¶ó‡ßà‡¶õ‡¶ø‡¶≤‡•§ ‡¶è‡¶á ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡ßá‡ß±‡¶≤ ‡¶∏‡ßá‡¶á‡¶¨‡ßã‡ß∞ ‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶ï‡¶§ ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶≠‡¶æ‡ß±‡¶ø‡¶§ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡ßá ‡¶Ø'‡¶§ phase1 sql-‡¶è ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶á‡¶ö‡¶§ ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶õ‡ßÅ‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶Ø ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡ßá, ‡¶Ø‡ßá‡¶®‡ßá CREATE table, ‡¶Ü‡¶¶‡¶ø‡ß∞ ‡¶¶‡ß∞‡ßá‡•§ ## üß∏ ‡¶™‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶∏‡ß∞ BIRD-INTERACT, ‡¶è‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶á‡¶®‡ßç‡¶ü‡¶æ‡ß∞‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶ü‡¶ø‡¶≠ ‡¶ü‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶∏‡¶ü-‡¶ü‡ßÅ-SQL ‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶û‡ßç‡¶ö‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶ï, **dynamic interaction-‡ß∞ lens-‡¶è Text-to-SQL ‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡ßü‡¶®‡¶ï ‡¶™‡ßÅ‡¶®‡ß∞ ‡¶ï‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶™‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡ßá**‡•§ ‡¶è‡¶á environment-‡¶è ‡¶è‡¶ü‡¶æ hierarchical knowledge base, database documentation ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ ‡¶è‡¶ü‡¶æ function-driven user simulator-‡ß∞ ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶Æ‡¶ø‡¶∂‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶£ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ø ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶™‡ßÇ‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶£ **CRUD** ‡¶Ö‡¶™‡¶æ‡ß∞‡ßá‡¶∂‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶®‡ß∞ ‡¶∏‡ßà‡¶§‡ßá authentic enterprise environment ‡¶™‡ßÅ‡¶®‡ß∞‡ßÅ‡¶§‡ßç‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶® ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡ßá‡•§ ‡¶á ‡¶¶‡ßÅ‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶†‡ßã‡ß∞ ‡¶™‡ß∞‡ßÄ‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶∑‡¶æ ‡¶Æ‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶¶‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡ßá: (1) ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶∏‡¶ø‡¶≠ **Conversational Interaction** ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ (2) ‡¶è‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶ü‡¶ø‡¶≠ **Agentic Interaction**, ‡ß¨‡ß¶‡ß¶ ‡¶ü‡¶æ annotated task-‡ß∞ ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶§‡¶æ‡ß∞‡¶§ Business Intelligence (BI), CRUD ‡¶Ö‡¶™‡¶æ‡ß∞‡ßá‡¶∂‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶® ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ ‡¶Ü‡¶¶‡¶ø, ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶ü‡ßã executable test case-‡ß∞‡ßá ‡¶∏‡ßÅ‡ß∞‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶∑‡¶ø‡¶§‡•§ ‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶ß‡¶æ‡ß∞‡¶£ ‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡ßü‡¶®‡¶§ ‡ßß,‡ßØ‡ß¨‡ßÆ-‡ß´,‡ß™‡ßØ‡ß¨ interaction turn ‡¶Æ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶≤ ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ user simulator-‡ß∞ ‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶ú‡¶§ ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ò‡¶ü‡¶ø‡¶§ ‡¶π‡ßü, ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ state-of-the-art reasoning model-‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶π ‡¶¨‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶§‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶ï‡ßá‡ß±‡¶≤ **‚âà‡ß®‡ß™%** ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ **‚âà‡ßß‡ßÆ%** task ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶ß‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡ßá, ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶´‡¶≤‡¶§ ‡¶è‡¶á ‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶û‡ßç‡¶ö‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶ï‡ß∞ challenge ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶™‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü ‡¶π‡ßü‡•§

### ‚úÖ ‡¶¶‡ßÅ‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡ßü‡¶® ‡¶Æ‡ßã‡¶° BIRD-INTERACT-‡¶è ‡¶ì‡¶™‡ß∞‡¶§ ‡¶â‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶ñ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶æ ‡¶¶‡ßÅ‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡ßü‡¶® ‡¶Æ‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶•‡¶® ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡ßá: - **c-Interact**: Conversational Interaction ‡¶Ø‡¶ø ‡¶è‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶∏‡¶ø‡¶≠ ‡¶Æ‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ workflow ‡¶®‡¶ø‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü‡•§ ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶§‡ßÉ‡¶§ ‡¶§‡¶•‡ßç‡¶Ø `bird_interact_conv`-‡¶§ ‡¶™‡ßã‡ß±‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡•§ - **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction ‡¶Ø‡¶ø embodied active ‡¶Æ‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ workflow dynamic ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ ‡¶Æ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶≤-‡ß∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡ßá‡¶§‡ßÉ‡¶§‡ßç‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡ßü‡•§ ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶§‡ßÉ‡¶§ ‡¶§‡¶•‡ßç‡¶Ø `bird_interact_agent`-‡¶§ ‡¶™‡ßã‡ß±‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡•§

RowTranslations.originContent: BIRD-INTERACT supports two evaluation modes as mentioned above:
- **c-Interact**: Conversational Interaction which is a passive mode and the workflow is fixed. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_conv`.
- **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction which is an embodied active mode where the workflow is dynamic and led by models. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_agent`.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction ‡¶Ø‡¶ø embodied active ‡¶Æ‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ workflow dynamic ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ ‡¶Æ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶≤-‡ß∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡ßá‡¶§‡ßÉ‡¶§‡ßç‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡ßü‡•§ ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶§‡ßÉ‡¶§ ‡¶§‡¶•‡ßç‡¶Ø `bird_interact_agent`-‡¶§ ‡¶™‡ßã‡ß±‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡•§

Content: ### üê£ Lite Version We are releasing a lite version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, which includes 270 high-quality real-world tasks specifically for PostgreSQL. This is a good starting point for quick experimentation. ### ü¶ú Full Version The full version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, is a comprehensive benchmark that includes 600 tasks for PostgreSQL. It covers a wide range of SQL operations and user queries. The full version is coming soon. ### Model Performance Results on BIRD-INTERACT Lite #### 1. **c-Interact** Performance | Rank | Model Name | Normalized Reward | Level | |:------:|--------------------|:-------:|:--------------:| | 1 | o3-mini | 33.04 | üèÜ Excellent Chat | | 2 | GPT-4o | 30.33 | üíé Good Chat | | 3 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 27.41 | üíé Good Chat | | 4 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 26.60 | ‚ú® Standard | | 5 | DeepSeek-R1 | 21.74 | ‚ú® Standard | | 6 | Qwen3 | 20.33 | ‚ö™ Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-V3 | 15.85 | ‚ö™ Basic | #### 2. **a-Interact** Performance | Rank | Model Name | Budget Parameters* | Avg Steps/Task | Avg Cost (USD)/Task | Normalized Reward | Level | |:------:|--------------------|:-------------------:|:----------------:|:---------------------:|:-------------------:|:---------------------:| | 1 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 6/6 | 15.4 | $0.6668 | 29.19 | üèÜ Excellent Interaction | | 2 | o3-mini | 6/6 | 7.8 | $0.0754 | 21.07 | üíé Good Interaction | | 3 | DeepSeek-V3 | 6/6 | 15.6 | $0.0629 | 19.19 | üíé Good Interaction | | 4 | Qwen3 | 6/6 | 12.5 | $0.0278 | 18.74 | ‚ú® Standard | | 5 | GPT-4o | 6/6 | 15.3 | $0.4594 | 18.37 | ‚ú® Standard | | 6 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 6/6 | 13.2 | $0.0337 | 17.26 | ‚ö™ Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-R1 | 6/6 | 12.0 | $0.0931 | 17.07 | ‚ö™ Basic | > \* Budget Parameters: Starting Budget/User Patience Budget, measured by our virtual currency *bird-coin*s . Refer to [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) for more details. ### Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) refers to a model's ability to continuously increase its end performance through multi-turn interactions. When this interactive performance surpasses the model's idealized single-turn performance on a fully specified, unambiguous task, we say it satisfies the **ITS law**. As user patience grows and interaction turns accumulate, performance keeps improving, demonstrating that the model can sustain effective communication over extended dialogue. Currently, we only find claude-3-7-sonnet satisfies the ITS law.

RowTranslations.originContent: We are releasing a lite version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, which includes 270 high-quality real-world tasks specifically for PostgreSQL. This is a good starting point for quick experimentation.

The full version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, is a comprehensive benchmark that includes 600 tasks for PostgreSQL. It covers a wide range of SQL operations and user queries. The full version is coming soon.
### Model Performance Results on BIRD-INTERACT Lite
| Rank | Model Name         | Normalized Reward | Level        |

RowTranslations.originContent: > \* Budget Parameters: Starting Budget/User Patience Budget, measured by our virtual currency *bird-coin*s . Refer to [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) for more details.

Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) refers to a model's ability to continuously increase its end performance through multi-turn interactions. When this interactive performance surpasses the model's idealized single-turn performance on a fully specified, unambiguous task, we say it satisfies the **ITS law**. As user patience grows and interaction turns accumulate, performance keeps improving, demonstrating that the model can sustain effective communication over extended dialogue. Currently, we only find claude-3-7-sonnet satisfies the ITS law.

Content: ## üì¶ Dataset Details ### Dataset Description - **Database:** The complete PostgreSQL database can be download from [the Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Check the [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) section for more details. - **data:** Each data instance contain the following main parts: - `selected_database`: The name of the database. - `query`: The unambiguous user query. - `amb_user_query`: The user query with injected ambiguities. - `user_query_ambiguity`: The ambiguities injected into the user query. - `non_critical_ambiguity`: The non-critical ambiguities like order, limit, etc. - `knowledge_ambiguity`: The ambiguities created by masked external knowledges. - `sol_sql`: The ground truth SQL solution. - `preprocess_sql`: SQL queries to run before executing the solution or prediction. - `clean_up_sql`: SQL queries to run after the test cases to revert any changes made to the database. - `test_cases`: A set of test cases to validate the predicted corrected SQL. - `follow_up`: The labeled follow up questions. - `external_knowledge`: The external knowledge related to the specific task. - **evaluation:** The evaluation code is available in the [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) directory. - **Curated by:** BIRD Team & Google Cloud - **License:** [cc-by-sa-4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) - **HuggingFace Dataset Card:** [bird-interact-lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-lite) ### Dataset Uses To avoid data leakage by auto-crawling, we do not include GT solution sqls and test cases along with data. please email [bird.bench25@gmail.com](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/mailto:bird.bench25@gmail.com) with the tag `[bird-interact-lite GT&Test Cases]` in title for full set, which will be sent automatically.
Translation: ## üì¶ ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶ö‡ßá‡¶ü‡ß∞ ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶¨‡ß∞‡¶£ ### ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶ö‡ßá‡¶ü‡ß∞ ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡ß±‡ß∞‡¶£ - **‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶õ:** ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶™‡ßÇ‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶£ PostgreSQL ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶õ [Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view) ‡ß∞ ‡¶™‡ß∞‡¶æ ‡¶°‡¶æ‡¶â‡¶®‡¶≤‡ßã‡¶° ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶¨ ‡¶™‡¶æ‡ß∞‡¶ø‡•§ ‡¶Ö‡¶ß‡¶ø‡¶ï ‡¶§‡¶•‡ßç‡¶Ø‡ß∞ ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) ‡¶ö‡¶ø‡¶§‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶ü‡ßã ‡¶ö‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶ï‡•§ - **data:** ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶§‡ßç‡¶Ø‡ßá‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶á‡¶®‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü‡ßá‡¶®‡ßç‡¶∏‡¶§ ‡¶§‡¶≤‡¶§ ‡¶â‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶ñ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶æ ‡¶Æ‡ßÅ‡¶ñ‡ßç‡¶Ø ‡¶Ö‡¶Ç‡¶∂‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶π ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡ßá: - `selected_database`: ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶õ‡ß∞ ‡¶®‡¶æ‡¶Æ‡•§ - `query`: ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶™‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü ‡¶á‡¶â‡¶ú‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶ï‡ßÅ‡ß±‡ßá‡ß∞‡ßÄ‡•§ - `amb_user_query`: ‡¶è‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶ó‡ßÅ‡¶á‡¶ü‡¶ø ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶Ø‡ßÅ‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶§ ‡¶á‡¶â‡¶ú‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶ï‡ßÅ‡ß±‡ßá‡ß∞‡ßÄ‡•§ - `user_query_ambiguity`: ‡¶á‡¶â‡¶ú‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶ï‡ßÅ‡ß±‡ßá‡ß∞‡ßÄ‡¶§ ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶Ø‡ßÅ‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶§ ‡¶è‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶ó‡ßÅ‡¶á‡¶ü‡¶ø‡•§ - `non_critical_ambiguity`: ‡¶Ö-‡¶ó‡ßÅ‡¶∞‡ßÅ‡¶§‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶™‡ßÇ‡¶∞‡ßç‡¶£ ‡¶è‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶ó‡ßÅ‡¶á‡¶ü‡¶ø ‡¶Ø‡ßá‡¶®‡ßá order, limit, ‡¶Ü‡¶¶‡¶ø‡•§ - `knowledge_ambiguity`: ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶π‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶ø‡¶ï ‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶Ü‡¶ö‡ßç‡¶õ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶§ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ø ‡¶∏‡ßÉ‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶æ ‡¶è‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶ó‡ßÅ‡¶á‡¶ü‡¶ø‡•§ - `sol_sql`: ‡¶ó‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶æ‡¶â‡¶£‡ßç‡¶° ‡¶ü‡ßç‡ß∞‡ßÅ‡¶• SQL ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶ß‡¶æ‡¶®‡•§ - `preprocess_sql`: ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶ß‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶¨‡¶æ ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡ßá‡¶°‡¶ø‡¶ï‡¶∂‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶® ‡¶è‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶∏‡¶ø‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶â‡¶ü ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶ó‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶ö‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¨‡¶≤‡¶ó‡ßÄ‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ SQL ‡¶ï‡ßÅ‡ß±‡ßá‡ß∞‡ßÄ‡•§ - `clean_up_sql`: ‡¶ü‡ßá‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶á‡¶õ‡ß∞ ‡¶™‡¶ø‡¶õ‡¶§ ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶õ‡¶§ ‡¶π‡ßã‡ß±‡¶æ ‡¶™‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶¨‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶§‡¶® ‡¶™‡ßÅ‡¶®‡ß∞‡ßÅ‡¶¶‡ßç‡¶ß‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶¨‡¶≤‡ßà ‡¶ö‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¨‡¶≤‡¶ó‡ßÄ‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ SQL ‡¶ï‡ßÅ‡ß±‡ßá‡ß∞‡ßÄ‡•§ - `test_cases`: ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡ßá‡¶°‡¶ø‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶ü ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶æ SQL ‡¶∏‡¶†‡¶ø‡¶ï‡¶§‡¶æ‡¶∏‡ßÇ‡¶ö‡¶ï ‡¶™‡ß∞‡ßÄ‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶∑‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶á‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶ü‡ßá‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶á‡¶õ‡•§ - `follow_up`: ‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶≤ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶æ follow up ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶∂‡ßç‡¶®‡•§ - `external_knowledge`: ‡¶®‡¶ø‡¶∞‡ßç‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü ‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶ï‡¶§ ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶æ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ó‡¶ø‡¶ï ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶π‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶ø‡¶ï ‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ‡¶®‡•§ - **evaluation:** ‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡ßü‡¶®‡ß∞ ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶° [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) ‡¶°‡¶æ‡¶á‡ß∞‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶ü‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶§ ‡¶â‡¶™‡¶≤‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶ß‡•§ - **Curated by:** BIRD Team & Google Cloud - **License:** [cc-by-sa-4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) - **HuggingFace Dataset Card:** [bird-interact-lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-lite) ### ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶ö‡ßá‡¶ü‡ß∞ ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡ß±‡¶π‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶Ö‡¶ü‡ßã-‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶≤‡¶ø‡¶Ç‡ß∞ ‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶ß‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶Æ‡ßá ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶≤‡¶ø‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶ú ‡ß∞‡ßã‡¶ß ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶¨‡¶≤‡ßà, ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶ø GT ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶ß‡¶æ‡¶® sql ‡¶Ü‡ß∞‡ßÅ ‡¶ü‡ßá‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶á‡¶õ ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ‡ß∞ ‡¶≤‡¶ó‡¶§ ‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶Ø‡ßÅ‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶§ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶æ ‡¶®‡¶æ‡¶á‡•§ ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶™‡ßÇ‡ß∞‡ßç‡¶£ ‡¶õ‡ßá‡¶ü‡ß∞ ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶Ö‡¶®‡ßÅ‡¶ó‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶π ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ø [bird.bench25@gmail.com](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/mailto:bird.bench25@gmail.com) ‡¶§ `[bird-interact-lite GT&Test Cases]` ‡¶ü‡ßá‡¶ó ‡¶∏‡¶π ‡¶á‡¶Æ‡ßá‡¶á‡¶≤ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶ï, ‡¶Ø‡¶ø ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶Ç‡¶ï‡ßç‡ß∞‡¶ø‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶≠‡¶æ‡ß±‡ßá ‡¶™‡ßç‡ß∞‡ßá‡ß∞‡¶£ ‡¶ï‡ß∞‡¶æ ‡¶π‚Äô‡¶¨‡•§

RowTranslations.originContent: - **Database:** The complete PostgreSQL database can be download from [the Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Check the [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) section for more details.
- **data:** Each data instance contain the following main parts:
- `amb_user_query`: The user query with injected ambiguities.
- `user_query_ambiguity`: The ambiguities injected into the user query.
- `non_critical_ambiguity`: The non-critical ambiguities like order, limit, etc.
- `knowledge_ambiguity`: The ambiguities created by masked external knowledges.
- `preprocess_sql`: SQL queries to run before executing the solution or prediction.
- `clean_up_sql`: SQL queries to run after the test cases to revert any changes made to the database.
- `test_cases`: A set of test cases to validate the predicted corrected SQL.
- `external_knowledge`: The external knowledge related to the specific task.
- **evaluation:** The evaluation code is available in the [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) directory.
To avoid data leakage by auto-crawling, we do not include GT solution sqls and test cases along with data.

please email [bird.bench25@gmail.com](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/mailto:bird.bench25@gmail.com) with the tag `[bird-interact-lite GT&Test Cases]` in title for full set, which will be sent automatically.
You can download the dataset from HuggingFace using the following command:

Content:
```bash
from datasets import load_dataset
# Load the flash version of the dataset
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-lite")
print(dataset["lite"][0])

# Load the full version of the dataset (coming soon)
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-full")
print(dataset["full"][0])
```
Translation:
```bash
from datasets import load_dataset
# Load the flash version of the dataset
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-lite")
print(dataset["lite"][0])

# Load the full version of the dataset (coming soon)
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-full")
print(dataset["full"][0])
```

Content:
```bash
cd baseline/data
python pull_data.py \
  --schema_path path/to/full_schema.jsonl \
  --input_path path/to/input.jsonl \ # Path to the input JSONL file (may be empty if you want to download the dataset from HuggingFace)
  --output_folder path/to/output_dir # output folder of the split files
``` -->

  --output_folder path/to/output_dir # ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶≠‡¶æ‡¶ú‡¶ø‡¶§ ‡¶´‡¶æ‡¶á‡¶≤‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶π‡ß∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶â‡¶ü‡¶™‡ßÅ‡¶ü ‡¶´‡ßã‡¶≤‡ßç‡¶°‡¶æ‡ß∞
